title: Marlins officials to visit Portland
subtitle: Marlins officials to visit Portland
body: MIAMI -- In their quest to secure a new stadium, representatives of the Florida Marlins on Monday will visit Portland, Ore.  According to P.J. Loyello, the clubs senior vice president of media and communications, Marlins officials will spend Monday exploring Portland as a potential relocation site.  Team president David Samson, vice chairman Joel Mael and Claude Delorme, senior vice president of stadium development, will meet with Portland officials. Last month, the same three team executives visited San Antonio, Texas. Joe Frisaro is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Joe Frisaro
